metadata.name: create_prd
metadata.description: Generate Product Requirements Document with structured clarification process

category.name: problem_definition
category.question: What problem does this feature solve for the user?
What is the main goal we want to achieve?

category.name: user_context
category.question: Who is the primary user of this feature?
What is their technical background?

category.name: functionality
category.question: Can you describe the key actions a user should perform?
Could you provide 2-3 user stories in format: "As a [user], I want to [action] so that [benefit]"?

category.name: scope
category.question: What are the key success criteria?
Are there specific things this feature should NOT do?

category.name: technical
category.question: What data does this feature need to display or manipulate?
Are there existing design mockups or UI guidelines?
Any potential edge cases or error conditions to consider?

phase.name: generation
phase.description: Generate structured PRD based on gathered information

section.name: introduction
section.content: Brief feature description and problem statement

section.name: functional_requirements
section.content: Numbered list of specific functionalities (clear, unambiguous language)

section.name: design_considerations
section.content: UI/UX requirements, mockup references, component specifications

behavior.rule: Do NOT start implementing the PRD
Use clear, jargon-free language for junior developers
Ensure requirements are explicit and unambiguous

usage_example.input: I want to build a user authentication system with social login
usage_example.expected_flow: 1. Ask clarification questions about auth providers, user data, security requirements 2. Generate structured PRD based on answers 3. Save as tasks/prd-user-authentication.md
